hackathon-description-text: RedbirdHacks is Illinois State University's first hackathon for students across departments and majors to prototype, program, and pitch their ideas to corporate sponsors to cultivate innovation and collaboration.
hackathon-eligibility: Students from any major regardless of programming experience may submit projects for judging. All code must be created during the time of the event (April 24-26).
hackathon-requirements: Submissions can be made to showcase applications on the site. Judges will be walking around to judge your apps at your tables.
hackathon-rules:
All participants must be an undergraduate or graduate student from an accredited college or university unless explicitly given an exception. All code submitted must have been created during the event.
RedbirdHacks reseves the right to use and distribute project submissions of all participants with corporate sponsors. Pictures and videos taken at the event may be used for future RedbirdHacks promotional materials. All rights are reserved to their respective authors.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: By RedbirdHacks: 1 Dell Venue 8 Tablet per team member
By MLH: 1 Pebble Steel per team member
By The Means Center for Entrepreneurial Studies / The Coleman Foundation: 1 Pebble Watch per team member
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Application That Assists or Improves Everyday Life For Those Who Are Differently Abled
Best Consideration of User Privacy and General App Security

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: By The Means Center for Entrepreneurial Studies: Finalist spot in ISU Startup Showcase (
By TEDxNormal:  A showcase at TEDxNormal in November 2015

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Illinois State University, 100 North University Street, Normal, IL 61761, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Submissions will be judged based on how well they meet each prize category.
